page.title: 13Coulsdon & Purley Transport
page.content: Trains serve our area well. Although we have several stations people might live two miles (3km) from the nearest. The busiest time is when people are going to work, and the rush hour from four o'clock until six o'clock. Local train services are linked to the South Coast and London. Passengers go to London to link up with the National network. Our area is well served with buses. We have four different types; double-decker red buses, which take you into London; single-decker red buses for around Croydon; Greenline, a single green bus, takes you through London and Green country take you to quieter places. In the rush hour buses are crowded with commuters, tickets are bought on the bus. There are cheap tickets for children and pensioners.
